sen.j: 洋風画（ようふうが）は、明治時代以前、油彩画の道具が日本にまだ輸入されていなかった頃に、西洋画を見よう見真似で描いた絵。
sen.e: Western-influenced paintings were made in the days prior to the Meiji Period when oil painting tools had not been imported to Japan and people drew such painting by following examples of Western paintings.

sen.e: While the same drawing technique as the Western paintings was employed, the tools were those available in Japan.

sen.e: Typical Western-influenced paintings include a series of Akita Ranga (a school of Dutch painting originated in Akita Prefecture) let by Naotake ODANO and Yoshiatsu SATAKE.
